users.title: Product Manager
users.description: Alice is a product manager with a passion for building user-friendly applications.

users.title: Software Engineer
users.description: Bob is a skilled software engineer specializing in full-stack development.

users.title: UX Designer
users.description: Charlie is a UX designer focused on creating intuitive user interfaces.

users.title: Data Analyst
users.description: Diana is a data analyst with expertise in data visualization and reporting.

users.title: Project Coordinator
users.description: Eva is a project coordinator adept at multitasking and managing timelines.

cards.diet: Herbivorous (feeds on leaves, flowers, and decaying plant matter)
cards.description: A terrestrial snail known for its variable shell color patterns, often found in gardens and grassy areas.

cards.habitat: Moist environments like leaf litter, under rocks and logs
cards.description: Also known as pillbugs, they are terrestrial crustaceans, known for their ability to roll into a ball.

cards.habitat: Gardens, homes, and various outdoor environments
cards.description: A small jumping spider recognizable by its black and white striped pattern, known for its agile movement.

cards.habitat: Soil, especially in gardens and farmland
cards.description: A vital soil organism that aerates and enriches the soil through its burrowing and feeding habits.

cards.diet: Aphids, mealybugs, and other small insects (as larvae)
cards.description: A small, delicate insect recognized by its green wings and golden eyes, useful for controlling pests.
Social insects renowned for their vital role in pollination and honey production.

cards.diet: Variety of foods including seeds, nectar, and other insects
cards.description: Small social insects that live in colonies and play important roles in the ecosystem.
Recognizable by their distinctive red or orange color with black spots, they are beneficial insects in pest control.

cards.habitat: Wetlands, marshes, and along lakes and streams
cards.description: A small, slender damselfly recognized for its striking blue coloration and black markings, often found near freshwater.

cards.diet: Leaves of deciduous trees and shrubs (larvae feed on various host plants)
cards.description: A distinctive moth known for its striking black and white coloration and hairy caterpillars, which are often found on plants.

cards.diet: Leaves and tender shoots of various plants
cards.description: A small, green weevil recognized for its elongated snout; it causes minimal damage to plants but can be a pest in gardens.

cards.diet: Leaves of various plants (larvae feed on a variety of foliage)
cards.description: The larval stage of the Lophocampa maculata, recognized for its bright yellow color and long hair-like setae, often considered harmless.
